result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory S Mercure was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid within 60 days of sentencing, unless payment arrangements are approved.  Penalty for non-payment shall be entry of civil judgment.   Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees.  Send payments to:  Clerk of Courts, Room 419, 415 Jackson Street, P O Box 2808, Oshkosh WI  54903-2808.

Consecutive to any previously imposed sentence.  Good time granted. No credit.  Huber granted if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  Defendant shall report, IN PERSON, to the Winnebago County Jail, Work Release Unit, WITHIN 72 HOURS, after sentencing with a completed GPS application and to arrange a report date.  Failure to report to jail/huber shall result in loss of work release privileges and a warrant shall be authorized.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
